units.title: Perform multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE tissue sections
units.text: For each retinal organoid and the primary adult tissue, we performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: This is a direct, actionable protocol step describing sample preparation and treatment.

units.title: Acquire tiled images at ×40 magnification with high-NA silicone oil objective
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high-numerical-aperture (NA) silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm) (Fig. 1c).
units.rationale: This specifies a precise imaging protocol with equipment and parameters.

units.title: Perform 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles with antibody elution
units.text: Here, we performed 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles. Images were acquired at ×40 magnification with a high-NA silicone oil objective, tiled across the tissue.
units.rationale: This describes a repeated, cyclical protocol step essential to the 4i methodology.

units.title: Stain, acquire, denoise, register, and segment nuclei in 96-well format
units.text: Stain - Acquire - Denoise - Register - Segment nuclei
units.rationale: This is a concise, sequential protocol workflow explicitly listed in the methods.

units.title: Use 32 MTUs for spatial tissue characterization
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and signaling pathways split into three color channels (Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1d–f). Thirty-two global MTUs resolve the tissue structure with image quality and label biological structures in individual samples.
units.rationale: This defines a key analytical protocol unit using MTUs to quantify tissue organization.

units.title: Perform hierarchical clustering and heat map visualization of protein expression in MTUs
units.text: Hierarchical clustering and heat map visualization of average protein expression within each MTU highlight how each protein stain associates with each MTU (Supplementary Fig. 4a).
units.rationale: This is a specific analytical procedure applied to MTU data.

units.title: Visualize protein expression variance using UMAP and assign cell types via scRNA-seq
units.text: Focusing on segmented nuclei in an exemplary 39-week organoid section, variance analysis in the protein expression feature space and visualization in a uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding revealed eight molecularly distinct nuclei clusters (Supplementary Fig. 4d,e), and comparison of protein expression with single-cell transcriptomes14 enabled cell type assignment to each nuclei cluster (Fig. 1h,i and Supplementary Fig. 4e,f).
units.rationale: This is a detailed, actionable computational protocol for cell type annotation.

units.title: Apply mosaic perturbations of transcription factors in organoids
units.text: We performed follow-up ‘in organoid’ mosaic perturbations of selected transcription factors (TFs) and focused on the orthodenticle homeobox 2 (OTX2) regulon required for human retinal neurogenesis23–25.
units.rationale: This describes an experimental intervention protocol performed in organoids.
